Package model

Interface User

All Known Subinterfaces:
UserModelExtension
All Known Implementing Classes:
UserImpl, UserModelExtensionImpl
public interface User
This interface is the model of user. Here we implement create and load portfolios. As user has a portfolio, it calls an object of portfolio and is able to access its methods. In part - 2 of the assignments all the additional features that are possible for a flexible portfolio like buying, selling of stocks, getting valuation,cost basis etc. are also added.

  • Method Details

    • createPortfolio

      void createPortfolio(String portfolioName, Map<String,Integer> stocks) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This function generates the portfolio of the user in form of a xml file.
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - the name of portfolio.
      stocks - a map consisting of ticker symbol and quantity.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if there is some error in writing to a xml file.

    • getPortfolioComposition

      StringBuilder getPortfolioComposition(String pName)
      This function gives the composition of portfolio in terms of portfolio name, stock ticker and it's quantity.
      Parameters:
      pName - name of the portfolio
      Returns:
      the composition of portfolio as stated above.

    • loadPortfolio

      String loadPortfolio(String pfName) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This function is used to load the portfolio(xml file) and read its content.
      Parameters:
      pfName - the file name or file path which needs to e loaded.
      Returns:
      the message whether the portfolio got loaded successfully or not.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the file has a wrong format or is unable to read the file.

    • isValidFormat

      boolean isValidFormat(String value)
      This function checks if the date is in correct format (yyyy-MM-dd).
      Parameters:
      value - the date which needs to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the date is in correct format and false otherwise.

    • getTotalValuation

      StringBuilder getTotalValuation(String date, String pName)
      This function gets the total value of entire portfolio on a particular date. It has a portfolio object and calls its function inside.
      Parameters:
      date - the date at which you need to find value of portfolio.
      pName - the name of the portfolio.
      Returns:
      the total valuation of portfolio on inputted date.

    • ifStocksExist

      boolean ifStocksExist(String ticker)
      This function checks if the ticker is valid or not. It checks if the ticker is defined in the enum.
      Parameters:
      ticker - the ticker which need to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if the ticker is present in the enum and false otherwise.

    • getName

      String getName()
      This function is used to get the name of the user.
      Returns:
      the name of the user.

    • setName

      void setName(String name)
      This function is used to set the name of the user.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of user which needs to be set.

    • getPortfoliosName

      StringBuilder getPortfoliosName()
      This function returns the names of all the portfolios of a particular user.
      Returns:
      the names of all the portfolios of a particular user.

    • checkPortfolioExists

      int checkPortfolioExists(String pName)
      This function checks if a portfolio with the given name already exists or not.
      Parameters:
      pName - the name of portfolio which you need to check.
      Returns:
      1 if the portfolio is present as an inflexible portfolio and return 2 is the portfolio is present as a flexible portfolio.

    • createFlexiblePortfolio

      void createFlexiblePortfolio(String portfolioName, List<Stocks> stocks, double commissionFee) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to create a Flexible portfolio. After the portfolio is created successfully. It is written to file as well as stored locally.
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - the name of the portfolio.
      stocks - the list of stocks with all the data needed to create a flexible portfolio.
      commissionFee - is the commission fee for each transaction.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the portfolio name already exists or if there is some error encountered while writing to the file.

    • getFlexiblePortfolioComposition

      StringBuilder getFlexiblePortfolioComposition(String pName, String date) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to get the composition of a flexible portfolio.
      Parameters:
      pName - is the portfolio name of the flexible portfolio whose composition user wishes to see.
      date - defines the date at the point of which the user can view the net composition of his portfolio till that date.
      Returns:
      the String Builder with the portfolio composition till that date.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when date is invalid.

    • loadFlexiblePortfolio

      String loadFlexiblePortfolio(String fileName) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method loads the Flexible Portfolio from the .json file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - is the name of the file to be loaded.
      Returns:
      the String with appropriate success/failure message on loading of the portfolio.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when there is some error is loading the portfolio from the file.

    • buyStocks

      String buyStocks(String ticker, double qty, String pName, String date, double commissionFee) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to buy stocks in a particular flexible portfolio.
      Parameters:
      ticker - is the stock ticker which is to be bought.
      qty - is the quantity of stocks to be bought.
      pName - is the name of the portfolio in which the user wants to buy the stocks.
      date - is the date at which he wishes to buy the stocks.
      commissionFee - is the commission fee for each transaction.
      Returns:
      the appropriate message of successful/unsuccessful buying of stocks.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when date is invalid.

    • sellStocks

      String sellStocks(String ticker, double qty, String pName, String date, double commissionFee) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to sell stocks in a particular flexible portfolio.
      Parameters:
      ticker - is the stock ticker which is to be sold.
      qty - is the quantity of stocks to be sold.
      pName - is the name of the portfolio in which the user wants to sell the stocks.
      date - is the date at which he wishes to sell the stocks.
      commissionFee - is the commission fee for each transaction.
      Returns:
      the appropriate message of successful/unsuccessful selling of stocks.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when date is invalid.

    • getFlexiblePortfolioTotalValuation

      StringBuilder getFlexiblePortfolioTotalValuation(String date, String pName) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to get total valuation of Flexible Portfolio on a particular date.
      Parameters:
      date - is the date at which user would like to determine the total portfolio valuation.
      pName - is the name of the portfolio whose valuation is to be determined.
      Returns:
      the valuation of the portfolio with the valuation breakdown of each stock.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when date is invalid.

    • validateDateAccToApi

      boolean validateDateAccToApi(String ticker, String date)
      This method determines if data for a particular date exists in the API call result or not.
      Parameters:
      ticker - is the stock ticker.
      date - is the date at which data is to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if data exists and false if it does not exist.

    • getCostBasis

      StringBuilder getCostBasis(String date, String pName) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method computes the cost basis for a particular portfolio till that date.
      Parameters:
      date - is the date till which the cost basis is to be computed.
      pName - is the name of the portfolio.
      Returns:
      the cost basis for that portfolio.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when date is invalid.

    • displayChart

      StringBuilder displayChart(String sDate, String eDate, String pName) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method displays the chart for the performance of portfolio over a period of time.
      Parameters:
      sDate - is the start date for plotting portfolio performance.
      eDate - is the end date for plotting the portfolio performance.
      pName - is the name of the portfolio.
      Returns:
      the chart for the portfolio performance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if there is any error in parsing date.

    • getFlexiblePortfolioList

      List<FlexiblePortfolio> getFlexiblePortfolioList()
      This method is a getter for flexible portfolios list.
      Returns:
      the list of flexible portfolios created by the user.

    • getDataStore

      DataStoreFromApi getDataStore()
      This method is used to get the data stored from API for a user.
      Returns:
      the data store object that stored that data.
